front.div:
Abstract:
It has been reported that delayed neuronal death @ND) in the
hippocampus following transient forebrain ischemia is associated with internucleosomal
DNA f@mentation, indicating apoptosis. This suggests that the process of DND is
energy dependent. Transient severe forebrain ischemia was induced in Mongolian
gerbils by bilateral occlusion
of the common carotid arteries. Post-ischemic
administration of 2-deoxy-D-glucose (2-DG), a glucose antimetabolite, markedly reduced
the occwence of ischexnia-induced DNA f?a.gmentation and DND in the hippocampus.
These results suggest that the reduction of energy dependent metabolism after ischemia
may be an attractive therapeutic strategy for preserving hippocampal neurons vulnerable
to ischemia.
